page.title: 04A Pen-Picture.
page.content: Today the Coxwold-Gilling Gap still remains very beautiful, untouched by industry, towns, cities, modern housing and technology. If we could take an aerial view of it, it would stand out as a patchwork of fields, green for the lush meadows, and golden yellow for the ripened corn ready to be harvested. Also we could see the old farms and barns situated in the middle of their lands. As well as that the large oak trees and deciduous woods would stand out as patches of thick green foliage. It is important that we preserve this area and save it for as long as we can from the steel jaws of industry or we will forget what the countryside is. It is for this reason that the {Howardian Hills}are to be declared an area of outstanding beauty.
